stories.text:
Hi,

I really like Fastmail. But as a privacy orientated company and mailprovider, why do you submit so much e-mail header information?

Your mail-header is really full with information not everyone else needs to have.

I just found out, that you're stripping sender IP information when sending mails (in the past you had to choose an extra smtp '565' port for it). That's nice, as you internally know the IPs - but no one else (no receiver needs to know my sending IP!).

But why not also strip the X-Mailer entry AND also delete information within the Mime Version entry?

No one needs to know the system I'm sending mails from - and also does not need to know which software version I'm running.

As it doesn't have any impact on mail-delivery it would be a nice move from your side to protect user's privacy a bit more as you already do.

Thx.
stories.title: Fastmail: As a privacy orientated company,why not strip more header information?
“It’s a bloodbath”: U.S. companies are pillaging Latin America’s tech talent

stories.text:
For me, after HN, I just habitually have google news as my goto for news articles.

If they chose to sell it because of whatever reason, how much money would it cost to acquire?

It seems like a sure way to make money, if the news displayed was pay to show up, but if it is just an unbiased algorithm, then maybe it wouldn’t be so valuable?
stories.title: Ask HN: How valuable an asset is Google News?
